page.title: 01GAZETTER
page.content: THE AREA IS ROLLING AGRICULTURAL LAND TYPICAL OF THIS PART OF EAST DEVON. THE FARMS ARE MAINLY DAIRY FARMS DISSECTED BY NUMEROUS TREE COVERED HEDGES.THE MAIN AREAS OF SETTLEMENT ARE HONITON (WEST END)TO THE EAST,AND THE VILLAGES OF AWLISCOMBE (NORTH), BUCKERELL (WEST) & WESTON 2 MILES W. OF HONITON. AWLISCOMBE IS SCATTERED & IS DIVIDED BY THE A373 ROAD. THE RIVER WOLF FLOWS THROUGH THE VALLEY TO JOIN THE OTTER AT WESTON. WESTON IS A HAMLET WITH SETTLEMENT MAINLY ROUND THE CROSS AREA. BUCKERELL IS A SMALL VILLAGE WITH THE CHURCH AS FOCAL POINT. HONITON (INCLUDING PART OF THE HIGH STREET) IS DENSELY POPULATED WITH SHOPS AND OTHER SERVICES. THE RAILWAY LIES EAST/WEST ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PART OF HONITON AND THE REST OF THE GRID, AND RUNS ALMOST PARALLEL TO THE A30 ROAD.
